resources.string: Configuration of Settings
Patient Name
Patient\'s Date Of Birth
Patient Details
Project Flags and Values
Project Debug Mode Flag
Email Enabling Flag
Setting to true will cause useful debug messages to be logged which will help the developer investigate any problems.
Setting this to true will cause emails to be sent when information needs to be sent to the carers.
Address
Telephone Number
National Health Service (NHS) Number
General Preferences for the Project
This screen is used to set up various details of the project. Please note that none of the changes will come into effect until you leave this screen.
Preferred Way of Addressing the Patient
Additional Settings for Email Messages
Enter the Email Signature
The signature is text they will be added at the end of any message emailed from this device.
"This section will enable all details about a patient to be recorded. "
This section enables various flags, that control the way the system works, to be configured.
This section is for various information that may be useful when sending email messages from this device.
Please enter the destination for any email (separate each with a comma)
Appointment Checking Time
This specifies how often, in minutes, the stored appointments will be processed.
Select Grid or List View
Check the box if a List View is wanted. The default is a Grid View
Group the Activities
Check the box if the activities are to be displayed in the groups that are defined
Speaking Clock
Tick to enable a speaking clock
Announce Device Presence
"If enabled the device will send its details on starting"
Monitor Service Data
Set up the data associated with the service which will monitor the microphone for any noises
Enable the monitor service
Setting this flag will cause the monitor service to be enabled
Monitor Trigger Level
Move the slider to set the level at which the monitoring service will be triggered by a sound. The value can be anything between 0 and 25000 (15000 will be adequate for a normally quiet room).
The level at which the monitor will be triggered
Monitor Start Time
Monitor Stop Time
When monitoring starts
When monitoring stops
Inactive Period in Minutes
The period, in minutes, after a noise is heard when subsequent monitoring will not take place.
Specify the time at which the monitoring service will start and when it will start to listen for noises whose volume exceeds the specified \'monitor trigger\'
Specify the time at which the monitor service will stop and therefore the time when noises will not be looked for.
Enable automatic recording
Start the sound recorder when a noise is detected
Duration of Recording
If automatic recording is enabled then when a noise is detected then the sound recorder will be started immediately and will continue to record for the time that you specify below.
Acquire Statistics
Acquire statistics and place in the project log
Dynamic IP Address
The IP address used to access the web server from the public internet.
Development Mode
This flag enables the app to be placed into development mode, which provides additionalfacilities for the developer.
Belkin WeMo Device Handling
This flag indicates whether the device is to be used for controlling Belkin WeMo devices.
Time in Seconds that Define \'Darkness\'

This defines the number of seconds that the light level must be below the trigger level in order for a \'darkness warning\' to be displayed.\n\nThe warning will only be displayed for a short period of time and will not be redisplayed until the light level has exceeded the \'rearm\' level.
Actions to be Taken to WeMo Devices when \'Darkness\' occurs

Enter the actions to be taken when \'darkness\' is declared. \n\nEach action relates to the screen or a Belkin WeMo device and is of the form \'<screen or device friendly name> <on or off>\' (e.g. \'WeMo:Lamp on\' or \'Screen:on\'). Each command is delimited by a \';\'
Actions to be Taken to WeMo Devices when the \'Darkness\' event is rearmed

Enter the actions to be taken when the \'darkness\' event is rearmed. \n\nEach action relates to the screen or a Belkin WeMo device and is of the form \'<screen or device friendly name> <on or off>\' (e.g. \'WeMo:Lamp on\' or \'Screen:on\'). Each command is delimited by a \';\'
Specify the Time when the Daily Scheduler Runs
The scheduler is responsible for setting alarms for appointments and reminders.

Specify the time when the daily scheduler is to run.\n\nThe scheduler creates alarms for all appointments and reminders that are to occur on that day as well as scheduling itself to run at the same time on the following day.
Lower Level of the Battery Charge
This specifies the lower level of the battery charge which will cause an action to occur.
Upper Level of the Battery Charge
This specifies the upper level of the battery charge which will cause an action to occur.
Lower Battery Charge Level Actions

Enter the actions to be taken when the lower charge level is reached. \n\nEach action relates to the screen or a Belkin WeMo device and is of the form \'<screen or device friendly name> <on or off>\' (e.g. \'WeMo:Lamp on\' or \'Screen:on\'). Each command is delimited by a \';\'
Upper Battery Charge Level Actions

Enter the actions to be taken when the upper charge level is reached. \n\nEach action relates to the screen or a Belkin WeMo device and is of the form \'<screen or device friendly name> <on or off>\' (e.g. \'WeMo:Lamp on\' or \'Screen:on\'). Each command is delimited by a \';\'
Ambient Light Triggers and Actions
This section enables the ambient light triggers and associated actions to be defined.
The date of birth of the patient.
Please enter the date of birth of the person that is being cared for.
Enter the full address where the patient normally resides.
Enter the full name of the patient.
Enter the NHS reference number which will normally be found on any communication with the doctor or hospital.
Enter the phone number on which the patient can normally be contacted.
Enter the name by which the patient prefers to be called.
Patient\'s NHS Reference Number
Send Email with Captured File
Enabling this flag will cause the file containing the captured sounds to be emailed to the nominated people.
Select the Device to be Cloned
User View Sorting Options
Initiate Bluetooth Discovery
Set this option so that device will perform a bluetooth discovery when the app starts.

This is the opacity that will be used for drawables that \'slide in\' to indicate certain warning conditions, examples of this are the \'low level\' warning, \'brightness OK\' warning, etc. \n\nThe opacity is 0 for transparent to 255 for fully opaque.
Opacity of Warning Drawables.
Enter Default Developer Name
Enter the Name (or Initials) of the Default Developer
Panic Alarm - Shake Parameters
This section enables the parameters associated with the \'shake facility\' in the Panic Alarm to be set.
If more than one shake happens within this period then they will be treated as if they were just one shake.
Multi-Shake Ignore Period
If the current shake occurs more than this time after the last shake then the number of shakes will be reset.
Inter-Shake Reset Period
This is the number of shakes which will cause the panic alarm to be activated.
Shake Number
This defines the speed of movement of the device that will signify \'a shake\'.\n\nA value of \'1.2\' is the default value.
Threshold
This is the time, in minutes, which must elapse after the carer\'s bluetooth device has disappeared before the visit is registered.
Carer Visit Definition Time
Actions at End of Visit
Actions at Start of Visit

This string contains the actions to be taken when the visit ends. 

Each action relates to the screen or a Belkin WeMo device and is of the form '<screen or device friendly name> <on or off>' (e.g. 'WeMo:Lamp on' or 'Screen:on'). Each command is delimited by a ';'

If you embed <CARER> within a string then it will be replaced the visiting carer's name.

This string contains the actions to be taken when the visit starts.

Each action relates to the screen or a Belkin WeMo device and is of the form '<screen or device friendly name> <on or off>' (e.g. 'WeMo:Lamp on' or 'Screen:on'). Each command is delimited by a ';'

If you embed <CARER> within a string then it will be replaced the visiting carer's name.
Actions at End of Visit Warning
Actions at Start of Visit Warning

This string contains the actions to be taken when the warning of the end of visit occurs. 

Each action relates to the screen or a Belkin WeMo device and is of the form '<screen or device friendly name> <on or off>' (e.g. 'WeMo:Lamp on' or 'Screen:on'). Each command is delimited by a ';'

If you embed <CARER> within a string then it will be replaced the visiting carer's name.

This string contains the actions to be taken when the warning of the start of visit occurs.

Each action relates to the screen or a Belkin WeMo device and is of the form '<screen or device friendly name> <on or off>' (e.g. 'WeMo:Lamp on' or 'Screen:on'). Each command is delimited by a ';'

If you embed <CARER> within a string then it will be replaced the visiting carer's name.
Clone File Size for Old Devices
Some old devices, that have a version of Android before HONEYCOMB, have problems with receiving large files so only those with a size below this value will be cloned.
Click Counter
The number of times the image in the user interface must be clicked before the associated activity is processed.
Supplied Package Names
Used to specified the installed package name for \'contacts\' and \'mail\' apps
Contacts Package Name
Specify the path of the app that will be used for handling contacts or leave blank for it not to be used
Mail Package Name
Specify the path of the app that will be used for handling mail or leave blank for it not to be used
Sensors
This section enables parameters associated with the hardware sensors to be changed.

Specify the rate, as samples per second, at which the in-built accelerometer will provide data to the listeners.\n\n It is only an approximate value and if the value of \'0\' is chosen then the default setting will be used.
Accelerometer Sample Rate
Actions if Proximity indicates Far
Actions if Proximity indicates Near

This string contains the actions to be taken when the proximity sensor indicates a \'far\' state. \n\nEach action relates to the screen or a Belkin WeMo device and is of the form \'<screen or device friendly name> <on or off>\' (e.g. \'WeMo:Lamp on\' or \'Screen:on\'). Each command is delimited by a \';\'

This string contains the actions to be taken when the proximity sensor indicates a \'near\' state. \n\nEach action relates to the screen or a Belkin WeMo device and is of the form \'<screen or device friendly name> <on or off>\' (e.g. \'WeMo:Lamp on\' or \'Screen:on\'). Each command is delimited by a \';\'
Alarms Restart the App
If an alarm is received when the app is not running then setting this flag will cause the app to be restarted and the alarm to be activated after a short delay.
Start Activity Automatically
Start an activity automatically when the user interface is started.
Enter Discovery Timeout
Select the timeout that will be used when discovering the network.\n\nThe value entered is in seconds.
Cannot change the battery triggers because the upper trigger is not greater than the lower.
Enter Required Date
Enter the start date from which the daily summaries will be based.
